title:
Generation of hypercubic cluster states in 1-4 dimensions in a simple
  optical system
authors:
Zhifan Zhou, Lu\'is E. E. de Araujo, Matt Dimario, Jie Zhao, Jing Su,
  Meng-Chang Wu, B. E. Anderson, Kevin M. Jones, Paul D. Lett
abstract:
Entangled graph states can be used for quantum sensing and computing
applications. Error correction in measurement-based quantum computing schemes
will require the construction of cluster states in at least 3 dimensions. Here
we generate 1-, 2-, 3-, and 4-dimensional optical frequency-mode cluster states
by sending broadband 2-mode vacuum-squeezed light through an electro-optical
modulator (EOM) driven with multiple frequencies. We create the squeezed light
using 4-wave mixing in Rb atomic vapor and mix the sideband frequencies
(qumodes) using an EOM, as proposed by Zhu et al. (1), producing a pattern of
entanglement correlations that constitute continuous-variable graph states
containing up to several hundred qumodes. We verify the entanglement structure
by using homodyne measurements to construct the covariance matrices and
evaluate the nullifiers. This technique enables scaling of optical cluster
states to multiple dimensions without increasing loss.
